properties.areaDesc: West Jackson and West Grand Counties Above 9000 Feet
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 31 at 2:41PM MST until January 3 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Denver CO
properties.description:
...A ROUND OF SNOW AND HAZARDOUS WINTER TRAVEL CONDITIONS FOR THE
NORTHERN MOUNTAINS...

.Snow will develop in the northern mountains of Colorado
Wednesday morning and become widespread by early afternoon. The
snow will continue Wednesday night before tapering off slightly on
Thursday. Snowfall will increase again Thursday night before
ending Friday morning. Gusty winds will also produce blowing and
drifting snow and reduced visibilities in exposed areas and over
the higher mountain passes. The heaviest totals can be expected in
the mountains north of Rabbit Ears Pass with moderate snowfall
totals in the Front Range Mountains and Summit County.

* WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 20
inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph.

* WHERE...Rabbit Ears Pass.

* WHEN...From 6 AM Wednesday to midnight MST Thursday night.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas
of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The
hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening
commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM WEDNESDAY TO MIDNIGHT MST THURSDAY NIGHT
